tool.name: OTB.DomainTransform
tool.description: Domain Transform application for wavelet and fourier
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayin False output_data_out $output_data_out name OTB.DomainTransform in $in out $out mode $mode mode.fft.shift $mode.fft.shift mode.wavelet.form $mode.wavelet.form mode.wavelet.nlevels $mode.wavelet.nlevels direction $direction ram $ram prefer $prefer response $response outputType_out $OutputSection_out.outputType_out transmissionMode_out $OutputSection_out.transmissionMode_out

param.name: in
param.label: This will take an input image to be transformed image. For FFT inverse transform, it expects a complex image as two-band image in which first band represent real part and second band represent imaginary part.
param.help: This will take an input image to be transformed image. For FFT inverse transform, it expects a complex image as two-band image in which first band represent real part and second band represent imaginary part. The following data types are allowed in the txt file: jpeg, png, tiff

param.name: out
param.label: This parameter holds the output file name to which transformed image will be written. This has a slightly different behaviour depending on transform type. For Wavelet, output is a single band image for both forward and inverse transform. For FFT forward transform, output is two band image where first band represents real part and second band represents imaginary part of a complex image.
param.help: This parameter holds the output file name to which transformed image will be written. This has a slightly different behaviour depending on transform type. For Wavelet, output is a single band image for both forward and inverse transform. For FFT forward transform, output is two band image where first band represents real part and second band represents imaginary part of a complex image.

param.name: mode
param.label: This parameter allows one to select between fft(fourier) and wavelet
param.help: This parameter allows one to select between fft(fourier) and wavelet

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.
